Description: Shoe for the right foot of a child, made of stitched red leather, with rounded toe, part of ankle and toe straps remaining, leather cord woven through uppers, stitched and bound, cloth adhering.
Curator's comments: Nicholson and Shaw, Ancient Egyptian Materials and Technology (Cambridge 2000), p. 316 fig.12.14 Veldmeijer, Studies of Ancient Egyptian Footwear. Technological Aspects. Part XVII. Leather Stubbed-Toe Ankle Shoes. Jaarbericht “ex oriente lux” 44, (2012-2013), pp. 3-6, 8, 16.
Original photograph AN364072001 taken by Adrianus t'Hooft and copyright assigned to the Museum
